jyVis.graphics
Class DrawingPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      jyVis.graphics.DrawingPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.Observer
Direct Known Subclasses:
CorrelationMatrix, HeatMap, ParallelCoordinates, RadViz, RadViz, ScatterPlot
public class DrawingPanel
extends java.awt.Component
implements java.util.Observer

The panel which draws visualization primitives and handles selection interaction. The default plotting range for these objects is 0,0,1,1. Once an object is added via the add(object) method, it is persistant.

Author:
Curran Kelleher
See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

window

public Window2D window
The window into the coordinate space in which objects in this panel are drawn.

propertyPanel

public java.awt.Component propertyPanel
the property panel associated with this drawing panel.

selectionPolygon

public java.awt.Polygon selectionPolygon
The polygon (in pixel space) which will be drawn to represent the selection as it is being made.

index

public VisualizationPrimitiveIndex index
The object used to spacially index the visualization primitives for efficient selection and mouse interactions.

selectionIsBeingMade

public static boolean selectionIsBeingMade
A flag indicating whether a selection is in the process of being made or not. This is used to signal whether or not to use anti-aliasing for drawing selected objects

data

public DataTable data
The data table associated with this JVDrawingPanel for the purpose of selection.

makeWindowSquare

public boolean makeWindowSquare
If true, then the window will always be square (not distorted). It is false by default

probingDimension

public int probingDimension
The dimension used for probing in this panel

Parameters:

updateDisplay

public void updateDisplay()
Redraws the objects without re-indexing them for selection and mouse interactions. Use this method instead of updateDisplay() when the position of things is not changing for faster performance
